column4: hi all ... just have istalled ubuntu on my thinpad t21. my first question is how do i set up a higher desktop resolution ? ubuntu only offers me 640x480
: i had the same problem yesterday on my laptop after i had done an install
: what is the graphics card, do you know?
: well, i don
what do you mean with  i don ? (sorry for my poor english)

: well, i don't know what exatly caused my prblem. i had a beackup of my prior XF86Config which worked and i used that. the difference was a vertical and horizontal sync difference between the config files
: i had pressed return before completing what i was writing.
: laptop keyboards kinna small you know...
i see : no problem. so is it all about the xorg.conf in /etc/x11/ ?
: mine was warty though, so it was XF86Config-4 for me. but as i have said, i don't know what caused it, it happened after the upgrade.
: and luckily i had a backup, which was done by the nvidia driver installation.
: the resolutions should be in your xorg.conf.
: see if you got 1024x768 there.
yes they should. and the strange thing everything there is about 1024-768
: that is exactly what happened to me as well.
: my resolutions in there were all high, but it wasnt giving me anything other than 640x480
hold on.
maybe its because of the entry "standard monitor/display" ?
this is the only diff i got between configs that worked and that didnt. mind that my config file is not xorg.conf, but it might help.
: the one that works has:
that is the output of diff so disregard the > < chars
